class_notes: Participating students will work with Dr. Bhasin on developing 'virtual ensemble' audio and video editing skills while independently preparing, performing, and recording selected chamber works in a virtual format. This independent research course offers the opportunity to gain fluency in software programs including DaVinci Resolve, Audacity, ProTools, and others.  Open to any instrumentalist with instructor permission. Students will be expected to dedicate 1-4 hours per week to recording, editing, and virtual meetings with peers and faculty. Students will also be expected to adhere to production and editing timelines. Music majors and minors: This course many count as a music general elective.
course_description: Students conduct independent research in support of their own research agenda or question with guidance from a faculty member. Permission of the department and a supervising faculty member is required.
